New Records: Lionel Messi scored his 109th international goal, moving closer to the record for most goals in Copa America history, with 14 goals, three shy of the record.
Key Match Events: Lionel Messi scored the second goal for Argentina in the 51st minute, redirecting Enzo Fernández’s shot.
Julián Álvarez scored the opening goal for Argentina in the 22nd minute.
Emiliano Martínez made crucial saves against Jonathan David and Tani Oluwaseyi to preserve Argentina's lead.
Alphonso Davies of Canada limped off in the 71st minute after a challenge with Gonzalo Montiel.
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Messi expressed his amazement at Argentina's achievements and acknowledged the significance of reaching another final.
Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni emphasized the importance of winning over statistics.
Canada coach Jesse Marsch reflected on the challenges faced by his team, including heat, travel, and the need for more player development.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a temporary grass surface at MetLife Stadium, which appeared heavy and affected play.
The crowd of 80,102 was overwhelmingly pro-Argentina, with only a few sections of Canadian supporters.
Argentina extended its unbeaten streak to 10 games with this victory.
The temperature during the match was 82 degrees with 82% humidity.
